translation: And the great army was pursuing him.
Asumedh went to the kingdom of Maharaja Tilak,

transliteration: Raaj Paat Vaa Hoo Kau Chhaadaa||17||270||
translation: Who was a most appropriate king.17.270.

gurmukhi: ਪੰਡਤ ਬਡੋ ਮਹਾਂ ਬਡ ਗੁਨਿ ਜਨ ||
transliteration: Pandat Bado Mahaan Bad Goun(i) Jan||
translation: He was a very great Pundit and had many great qualities.

gurmukhi: ਭੂਪਹਿ ਕੋ ਗੁਰ ਸਭਹੁ ਕੀ ਪੂਜਾ ||
translation: He was the preceptor of the king and all worshiped him.

gurmukhi: ਤਿਹ ਬਿਨੁ ਅਵਰੁ ਨ ਮਾਨਹਿ ਦੂਜਾ ||੧੮||੨੭੧||
transliteration: Tih Bin(u) Avar(u) Na Maanah(i) Doojaa||18||271||

gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਬਾਨੀ ਕਰਹਿ ਬੇਦ ਚਰਚਾ ||
translation: Somewhere there was the recitation of Upnishads and somewhere there was discussion about the Vedas.

gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਬਿਪ੍ਰ ਬੈਠੇ ਕਰਹਿ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਅਰਚਾ ||
transliteration: Kahoon Birpa Baithe Karah(i) Brahm Archaa||
translation: Somewhere the Brahmins were seated together and worshipping Brahman;

gurmukhi: ਤਹਾ ਬਿੱਪ੍ਰ ਸੱਨੌਢ ਤੇ ੲੇਕ ਲੱਛਨ ||
transliteration: Tahaa Bippra Sannaudh Te Ek Lachchhan||
translation: There the Sanaudh Brahmin lived with such qualifications:

gurmukhi: ਕਰੈ ਬਕਲ ਬਸਤ੍ਰੰ ਫਿਰੈ ਬਾੲਿ ਭੱਛਨ ||੧||੨੭੨||
transliteration: Darai Bakal Bastran Phirai Bade Bhachchhan||1||272||
translation: He wore the clothes of the leaves and bark of birch tree and moved around subsisting only on air.1.272.

gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਬੇਦ ਸਯਾਮੰ ਸੁਰੰ ਸਾਥ ਗਾਵੈ ||
transliteration: Kahoon Bed Syaamannd Suran Saath Gadvai||
translation: Somewhere the hymns of Sam Veda were sung melodiously;

gurmukhi: ਕਹੂੰ ਜੁਜਰ ਬੇਦੰ ਪੜੈ ਮਾਨ ਪਾਵੈ ||
transliteration: Kahoon Jujar Bedan Padai Maan Paavai||
translation: Somewhere the Yajur Veda was being recited and honours were received;
